intro: Restrepia flosculata var. picta, commonly known as the painted orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, often colorful flowers that can range from white to pink and purple. The plant typically features a rhizomatous root system and produces pseudobulbs that support its foliage. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its ornamental appeal. The flowers bloom in late spring or early summer, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
